definition: to break down/to break into pieces/fragmentary

sentences.english: In the butcher shop this organ is sold as sweetbread (from a cow).
sentences.chinese: 这个器官在肉铺卖叫杂碎。

sentences.english: The list ended up with sweetbreads.
sentences.chinese: 那一连串菜单的最后一道是牛杂碎。

sentences.english: Street vendors cooked and sold what could only be described as "offal baguettes". People stared at me.
sentences.chinese: 小贩在烧煮和贩卖“杂碎面包”，人们朝我瞪着眼睛。

sentences.english: These scumbags were seen casing this place earlier tonight.
sentences.chinese: 今晚早些时候就有人看见这帮杂碎在这块儿踩盘子。

sentences.english: You're the all-singing, all-dancing crap of the world.
sentences.chinese: 你只不过是这个世界里唱歌跳舞的杂碎。

sentences.english: Lamb sold, but there is sheep offal left behind in the pan.
sentences.chinese: 羊肉卖了，但总有些羊杂碎遗落在锅里。

sentences.english: Viserion had shattered one chain and melted the others.
sentences.chinese: 韦赛里昂已经杂碎了一根锁链，融化了另一根。

sentences.english: Francesgiggled and said, "We'll have sweetbreads , please. And potatoes."
sentences.chinese: 法兰西斯吃吃笑着说，“我们要牛杂碎和马铃薯。”

sentences.english: 1896 - Chopsuey is invented in New York City.
sentences.chinese: 1896年的今天，“杂碎”这道菜在纽约城被发明。

definition: (derog.) old but still alive/old fart/old bastard
to slaughter livestock/to govern or rule/to cheat customers/imperial official in dynastic China
